ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: How to write better and about indigenous languages.
I gained a lot more knowledge and confidence in academic writing while also learning about language politics around the world which was such a great topic.

This class helped me improve my writing so much! Carson is definitely one of the best parts of this course; he was super understanding with deadlines (especially this semester) and was very accessibility for emails and/or meeting during or outside of office hours. The drafting process in ENGL 114 is very helpful, since you get feedback and are able to talk through your paper(s) prior to turning in your final draft.

I learned so much about world language politics and its intersection with culture and society. There were so many different connections i didn't make before taking this course. The readings were so incredibly engaging and made way for valuable discussions that made speaking in small class settings with confidence much easier.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: very engaging, fun classmates, lots of discussion, interesting topic
Weaknesses: Lots of work
I really appreciated the amount and clarity of feedback quickly available on our work. The readings were interesting and stimulated good discussions or were helpful for learning writing techniques.

Strengths: You will do a lot of writing in this class, but Carson is so understanding and is so accessible for feedback that he made this class a lot of fun. Even though this is a 9AM, I would still highly suggest it if you need a writing credit or even if you just want to become a better writer! 

Weakness: I honestly cannot think of anything!
I thought it was absolutely perfect.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: As good as covid could be
The breakout rooms, peer review, and annotations on our readings were very helpful to engage with the rest of the class.

I think that the short readings outside of class were very helpful, especially in jump starting our class discussions each day. I know that many people dislike breakout rooms in general, but we looked forward to our daily breakout rooms since we were a really small class and everyone got to know each other.

I truly think no other route could improve this course  it was great. Perusal was a wonderful method of interacting with our readings and our peers outside of class and class was always the highlight of my day.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. It was very interesting to learn about different indigenous languages and the fact that many of them are dying out.
Yes! This was a great writing credit, especially for STEM majors who want to improve their writing.
Yes, if you need a writing credit I would definitely suggest this class. ENGL 114 is generally a lot of writing regardless of which seminar you take, but Carson made this class really enjoyable.
YES. Absolutely take this course. Amazing professor, amazing knowledge, amazing opportunities for growth.
